definition: to repeatedly advise sb earnestly (idiom)/to admonish

sentences.english: He inculcates good manners in his children.
sentences.chinese: 他諄諄教導他的孩子們要懂規矩。

sentences.english: His predecessor Bill Clinton did not escape "criticism from Confucius" either.
sentences.chinese: 他的前任克林頓也沒能逃脫來自孔子的“諄諄教誨”。

sentences.english: We will keep in mind your earnest words.
sentences.chinese: 我們會牢記您的諄諄話語。

sentences.english: We must never be unworthy of our teachers' untiring and sincere teachings.
sentences.chinese: 我們決不要辜負老師的諄諄教導。

sentences.english: He beat in me the duties of loyalty and filial piety.
sentences.chinese: 他諄諄教導我要盡孝順之道。

sentences.english: He often inculcates in young people the duty of loyalty.
sentences.chinese: 他經常以忠貞之道諄諄教誨年輕人。

sentences.english: I will always remember the earnest teachings from Prof. Luo that guided me to the bright land.
sentences.chinese: 銘記羅師諄諄教導，引自己走向光明。

sentences.english: We failed to inculcate students with love of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 我們未能通過諄諄教誨使學生們熱愛知識。

sentences.english: Little Bush also deeply remember a father of inculcation.
sentences.chinese: 小布什也深深記得父親的諄諄教誨。

sentences.english: Consequently the ancients earnestly and tirelessly announces drop we, must not risk foolish " gas " .
sentences.chinese: 因而古人諄諄告戒我們，千萬不要冒傻“氣”。

sentences.english: You light our world with deep love and patient teaching.
sentences.chinese: 您用深沉的愛和諄諄教誨點亮了我們的世界。

sentences.english: They fail to inculcate student with love of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他們未能諄諄教誨使學生們愛好知識。

sentences.english: We' re moved by his devotion to his students.
sentences.chinese: 我們未能通過諄諄教誨使學生們熱愛知識。

sentences.english: He drummed two injunctions into the mind of the ignorant.
sentences.chinese: 他向愚昧無知的人羣諄諄教誨兩條誡命。
